## Twenty-fifth Amendment: A Plan for Presidential Succession

The Twenty-fifth Amendment explains what happens if the president can't do their job. It says the vice president takes over if the president dies, resigns, or is removed from office. The amendment also explains how to pick a new vice president if that office becomes empty.

It even has a plan for when the president can't perform their duties temporarily. In these cases, the vice president can take over until the president is ready to return.
title: Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution
